column4: When I'm booting it tells me to go to a certain website to install these drivers or something, but it goes by too quickly for me to catch it.
is it a graphical popup or a text message?
okay, can you pastebin your /var/log/syslog, the message should be in there
I couldn't tell you the card, but it's 9.10
sure, if you do lspci | grep -i network you should see some mention of a wireless card
oh sure sorry, Go to Applications > Terminal and then type in "lspci" and search for any mention of your wireless card
perfect, that's your wireless card. Now how did you install ubuntu?

ah right, well if you are still on the livecd then you probably can't install the drivers to get the wireless card working as it requires a reboot. However I'm reasonably certain that card works with ubuntu
ah yes, when it says key it means password. Is this a WEP encrypted access point?
not that I know off, only wpa2-enterprise can get a little sticky, but I doubt you are using that
awesome! Basically after you've installed you need to re-insert the CD and add it as a software source in System > Administration > Software Sources and then run System > Hardware Drivers
